The Gridt Network API

Interact with the gridt network via this API. It provides several endpoints for creating and subscribing (to) movements and switching leaders.
More information: gridt.org
Contact Info: robin@gridt.org
Version: 0.0.1
All rights reserved
http://apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html

Access

Methods

[ Jump to Models ]

Table of Contents

Default

  • post /auth
  • get /movements
  • get /movements/{movementId}
  • post /movements/{movementId}/leaders/{userId}/
  • delete /movements/{movementId}/subscriber
  • put /movements/{movementId}/subscriber
  • post /movements/{movementId}/update
  • post /movements
  • get /movements/subscriptions
  • post /register

Default

Up 
post /auth
Login to the gridt network (authPost)

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body body (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

inline_response_200

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Successfully logged in. inline_response_200

401

Failed to login, incorrect credentials. message
Up 
get /movements
List of all movements (movementsGet)
Lists all movements on the server.

Return type

movements

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Succesful response movements

401

Access token is missing or invalid message
Up 
get /movements/{movementId}
Get a movement (movementsMovementIdGet)

Path parameters

movementId (required)
Path Parameter — Name or id of a movement.

Return type

movement-with-subscribed

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Succesful response movement-with-subscribed

400

Movement id does not exist. message

401

Access token is missing or invalid message
Up 
post /movements/{movementId}/leaders/{userId}/
Swap leader in movement (movementsMovementIdLeadersUserIdPost)
Swap a leader in a movement with a different one.

Path parameters

movementId (required)
Path Parameter — Name or id of a movement.
userId (required)
Path Parameter — Identifier (name or id) of the leader that is to be replaced.

Return type

user

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

201

Succesfully swapped leaders, returns the new leader user

400

User is not subscribed to this movement. message

401

Access token is missing or invalid message
Up 
delete /movements/{movementId}/subscriber
Unsubscribe user from movement (movementsMovementIdSubscriberDelete)
The user that is currently logged in will be removed from the movement subscribers

Path parameters

movementId (required)
Path Parameter — Name or id of a movement.

Return type

message

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Sucessfully unsubscribed from this movement. message

400

This movement does not exist. message

401

Access token is missing or invalid message
Up 
put /movements/{movementId}/subscriber
Subscribe user to movement (movementsMovementIdSubscriberPut)
The user that is currently logged in will be added to the subscribers of this movement.

Path parameters

movementId (required)
Path Parameter — Name or id of a movement.

Return type

message

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Sucessfully subscribed to this movement. message

400

This movement does not exist. message

401

Access token is missing or invalid message
Up 
post /movements/{movementId}/update
Post a new update in movement (movementsMovementIdUpdatePost)
Tell the server that the user has performed the action related to this movement.

Path parameters

movementId (required)
Path Parameter — Name or id of a movement.

Return type

message

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

201

Successfully created update message

400

User is not subscribed to this movement. message

401

Access token is missing or invalid message
Up 
post /movements
Create a new movement (movementsPost)

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body movement-with-subscribed (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

movement-with-subscribed

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

201

Sucessfully created the new movement. movement-with-subscribed

400

Could not create movement, because it already exists. message

401

Access token is missing or invalid message
Up 
get /movements/subscriptions
Movements the user is subscribed to. (movementsSubscriptionsGet)
This will return a list of all the movements this user is subscribed to and all his leaders in this movements. This is the <strong>only</strong> place where the information of his leader can be obtained.

Return type

array[movement-with-leaders]

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Succesfully found the leaders of this user

401

Access token is missing or invalid message
Up 
post /register
Register an account (registerPost)

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body body_1 (required)
Body Parameter —

Return type

message

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

201

Sucessfully created an account message

400

Invalid request, either not all required fields are available, or the username is already in use. Check the message to find out. message

Models

Table of Contents

  1. body
  2. body_1
  3. id - Identifier
  4. inline_response_200
  5. message - Message from the server
  6. movement-with-leaders - Movement with leader information
  7. movement-with-subscribed - Movement with subscription information
  8. movements - List of movements
  9. user - User
  10. userId - User id
  11. user_lastupdate

body Up

username (optional)
String
password (optional)
String

body_1 Up

username (optional)
String
password (optional)
String
email (optional)
String

id - Identifier Up

identifier, can be it's name or an id.

inline_response_200 Up

access-token (optional)
String

message - Message from the server Up

message (optional)
String

movement-with-leaders - Movement with leader information Up

name (optional)
String Name of the movement
leaders (optional)
array[user]
short-description (optional)
String A comprehensive description of the movement
long-description (optional)
String A much longer description that is used to 'sell' a movement to it's users.
interval-days (optional)
Integer Amount of days in between which a follower of this movement is expected to perform the action
interval-weeks (optional)
Integer Amount of weeks in between which a follower of this movement is expected to perform the action.
interval-hours (optional)
Integer Amount of hours in between which a follower of this movement is expected to perform the action.
interval-months (optional)
Integer Amount of months in between which a follower of this movement is expected to perform the action.

movement-with-subscribed - Movement with subscription information Up

name (optional)
String Name of the movement
subscribed (optional)
Boolean True if the user is subscribed to this movement.
short-description (optional)
String A comprehensive description of the movement
long-description (optional)
String A much longer description that is used to 'sell' a movement to it's users.
interval-days (optional)
Integer Amount of days in between which a follower of this movement is expected to perform the action
interval-weeks (optional)
Integer Amount of weeks in between which a follower of this movement is expected to perform the action.
interval-hours (optional)
Integer Amount of hours in between which a follower of this movement is expected to perform the action.
interval-months (optional)
Integer Amount of months in between which a follower of this movement is expected to perform the action.

movements - List of movements Up

user - User Up

id (optional)
Integer The user's id
username (optional)
String The user's username
last-update (optional)
user_lastupdate

userId - User id Up

user_lastupdate Up

This is the last update that the user has given in this movement.
time-stamp (optional)
String Date time of the last update of the user.
